The prime minister's spokesman said today: The position at the present time is that the Crown Prosecution Service are carrying out an assessment of the information that is held by the Metropolitan police. That process is under way and it is up to the CPS to make a decision on their assessment. The prime minister's position is that if there are allegations of illegal behaviour, then those allegations need to be taken very seriously, but in all cases it is a matter for the police and the CPS. Thursday, he would earn about$ 334.7 million on the stock sale. He would still own about 2.7 percent of Google Inc. 's outstanding capital stock, down from 2.9 percent before selling the shares. As Google Inc. has grown, managing the business has become more complicated. So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making, Eric Schmidt said in a posting on the company's official blog." And over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured."

He said: First, there's the issue of David Cameron and George Osborne 's judgment, then there's the News of the World and what appears to be industrial phone hacking going on systematically." There's also the issue of the News Corp takeover of BSkyB and the apparent attempts by Jeremy Hunt, the Culture Secretary, to let that go through without proper scrutiny, and finally there's the extraordinary conduct of the police.
